title: Twisted Treeline Ranked — The Final Climb!
body:
#TL;DR:#
Twisted Treeline Ranked Flex will be enabled daily for the last two weeks of the 2017 Season! The queue will also be extended to 3pm–1am AEDT — the same hours that TT Normals are available. **TT Ranked will return to Thursday and Friday nights only on 07/11/17**.
~~~
After the announcement of the [2017 Ranked Season Rewards](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/2017-ranked-season-ends-november-7) - we've seen renewed interest in the Twisted Treeline Ranked Flex queue. 

Because of this, we've decided to turn Twisted Treeline Ranked Flex on **every day** until the end of the 2017 Season. This should help everyone making their final climb up the Ranked Ladder before the end of the season. We're also extending the start and finish times to match the up with the current Normal times (3pm–1am AEDT).


**End of Season Rewards:**
If you reach Gold in Twisted Treeline, you will earn a unique Chroma for Victorious Graves that is only available through this achievement.
If you reach Silver in at least two ranked queues, you earn the Victorious Ward Skin.

You can also earn a Summoner Icon based on your final rank in Twisted Treeline, as well as a ranked border that will appear in the loading screen of all of your TT games during the 2018 season. Check out the [2017 Season Rewards page for more details!](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/2017-ranked-season-ends-november-7)

# So, from 24/10/17 until 06/11/17 Twisted Treeline Flex Ranked will now be available daily from 3pm to 1am AEDT.


EDIT:

This is no longer the most recent Twisted Treeline Ranked Flex update, check out [this update](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/FKbiy2gY-twisted-treeline-ranked-schedule-preseason-update) for more up to date info.

replies.body:
I really think we need to increase the challenger slots by at least 1-2. A player named Bma has been challenger the entire season relentlessly playing his decay games and has only recently been kicked out by an up and comer. 

While of course  this is the nature of being in challenger and normally not be a problem there are currently ONLY 6 SLOTS IN CHALLENGER with some masters in the waiting. Compare this to Flex queue where there is 200 slots and they aren't even filled up yet. 

Increasing the days of the week twisted treeline can be played from 2 to 7 has been great for everyone and has shown everyone what an awesome experience twisted treeline can be. That said there is very little motivation for those at higher ranks to strive for the top positions as there is so little spots available. 

Please consider extending the spots to 8 to accommodate the masters who have grinded the entire season as opposed to the challenger flex who have not even filled out their 200 slots yet.

Even with the increased interest in TT, we ran the numbers, and 6 is the appropriate amount of Challenger slots in TT to keep it in line with solo/duo SR in terms of prestige. When we expanded from 3 to 6 slots, the appropriate amount for the time was 3 slots. The hope was that the queue population would stretch to fill 6 as an appropriate amount. It had an almost negligible effect. It only now fits the 6 slot limit due to how many more players are in the queue due to end of season rewards.

Flex having 200 slots is not ideal, given the decreased interest in the queue this year. I will be pushing to have SR Flex ranked slots limited to what they should be next season, only expanding if usage of the queue grows, similar to TT. No guarantee this will happen, will have to see what we can agree on internally.

Especially because of the timing, people like Bma who are students and have work and can only play a few days a week (which he has for the whole year and has stayed in challenger the whole year up until now) get screwed over from this erratic decision making by Riot.

coffee{{summoner:6}}
Decaf {{summoner:3}}
In addition to what Wuks mentioned you will also get the base skin for Victorious Graves if you achieve Gold in TT.

Nice one RIOT !

Would be nicer if you could have told us sooner or something or had the queues open earlier in the season rather than 'forcing' us to play it now and rush to get our rewards within 2 weeks :/

[The queue has infact been active since the start of the season](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/5ruA0Wov-scheduled-changes-to-ranked-queues-in-oce), and we've expanded it as much as we can during this year (it was on for 2 days a week for most of the year, and 4 days a week during the last week). 

Our aim is to have as many queues open as much as possible without having a negative impact on their matchmaking quality or time to get in game. Unfortunately, that sometimes means we have to work slowly to increase the time that a queue is active - but we want to be as aggressive as we can to expand how long queues are active for! 

In this case, we couldn't be sure how effective this would be until the rewards had been announced and we saw the level of impact they had on Ranked Twisted Treeline, as this is the first time we've seen a limited time Ranked Queue have rewards announced for it.

I think that's his point, Zaps.. the queues aren't open enough. 2 days a week during the year? Get real, that's not enough time, most people have lives and other things to do. So having them open all the time allows more people to enjoy them. 
It's like Ultra Rapid Fire; Everyone loves urf and your highest influx of players is during the times it's active. Maybe make them available more often or all the time..

I totally understand that it's not a great experience to only have it available two days a week.  This is not the end outcome we want for Twisted Treeline ranked - and as much as possible we want to push as hard as we can to expand the availability of the queue. 

The case with URF is actually pretty similar to what we're doing with the changes in this thread. There's something that is increasing the amount of interest in the queue for a limited period of time (URF vs other Rotating Game Modes) - so we're expanding the mode to be on as much as possible during that time (24/7 for URF, and 10/7 for Twisted Treeline). 

We're keeping a close eye on the data around the queue - and when things change to make it feasible to expand the time the queues are available we will take that option as aggressively as possible. 

On a side note, I've personally only played Twisted Treeline ranked this season... beyond anything else you can be certain that I've got self-interest in having the mode available as much as possible!

Well that's wonderful <3

RIOT PLEASE RESPOND 
it is 3pm now where is TT RANKED!!????
You might need to restart your client. Are you still having trouble finding it?
yes

So if you look at the queue list, select Twisted Treeline and start. There's no distinguishing marker between normals and ranked because normals is inactive at this time, and Ranked 3v3's is the only queue available.
should permanently open the TT queues and put missions for them if you want more people to play it.

I don't understand. So if I'm gold in solo/duo I get the Graves Skin. if I'm ALSO gold in flex I get a chroma. And if I'm ALSO gold in TT I get ANOTHER chroma? 

What if I'm silver in solo/duo and gold in all other queues?

Yep, here's how it works:

* If you get Gold in any queue, you get the Victorious Graves skin
* If you get Gold in a particular Queue (Ranked Solo SR, Ranked Flex SR or Ranked Flex TT) you get a specific Chroma for that queue.

So,  in your example:

* You got Gold in any queue, you got Victorious Graves
* You got Gold in Ranked Flex SR, you get the chroma for Ranked Flex SR
* You got Gold in Ranked Flex TT, you get the chroma for Ranked Flex TT
* You got Silver in Ranked Solo / Duo. You do not get the Ranked Solo chroma.
So in total you have the Graves skin and THREE separate chromas? One for each queue?

There are three separate chromas, yes.

In your example, you would earn two of them.

Is there a reason we cant just have this active all day? With the hours that I work I cant play this, Its already stupid that we only have ranked TT twice a week at terrible times but now you make it daily between horrible times for people like me who can only play in the morning cause I work at night

Unfortunately, the variation in the amount of players across time of day is really huge. 

I can't really go into specifics here around numbers - but the number of players falls off significantly each hour you move away from peak times. The way that this works is that the falloff actually accelerates more and more each hour you get further away from the peak hours of the day. 

I've spent a lot of my life working night shifts (including fun rotating day/night/evening shifts for a while!) - so I totally get the pain that comes from missing out on getting access to this - but unfortunately, the negative impacts to having the queue open during more hours of the day are too high if we push any further right now.

It might seem like there's little risk from expanding the queues further - but unfortunately that isn't the case. We've seen previously that expanding a queue too hard can actually lead to the queue suffering from longer queue times and matchmaking quality during the whole time period. Basically, this causes a negative feedback loop that can put the whole mode at risk.
6 slots for challenger wtf riot

What I find a little average is in the queue times thread (the other stricky) you said you would evaluate the queue being open more days for ranked after the 6/11 your now saying that it will go back to only 2 ranked days a week and its not 6/11 yet. So much for evaluating if it's possible to keep up the extended days. On a personal note the only reason I and 3 other friends have come back to league is because of the extended days 3v3 ranked is available.

I'm around low silver elo and queues pop instantly. 

Also can't have TT but there can be blind and draft for 5's on most of the time. So much for the excuse of splitting the player base.

Also with the rewards we can clearly say that this has increased the popularity of 3v3. Is it possible to have some ongoing rewards for playing 3v3 to motivate people to play it more often? This may not only help the health of the queue but allow us to expand its availability on a more permanent basis.

Reward e.g. Missions that involve 3v3 or a daily IP reward that involves 3v3.
"After 2017/11/05, we will analyse the impact of this change and make a decision around availability in preseason. Good luck with your final push up the ranks!"

Right, this is a bit unclear, I agree.

I would set the expectation that the queue will go back to it's previous schedule after the end of season. But, we are open to making appropriate expansions to the queue if enough players continue to play TT after end of season.
I'll talk with some other Rioters next week about actually leaving some of the expanded time open after season end for a little while to see if interest sticks (it does make more sense, I just pushed for the more cautious approach in the announcement). But if it goes back to pre-reward announcement popularity levels, expanding it much at all has a good chance of killing the mode outright.

The thing about motivating players to play a queue for rewards is that it's an overall unsatisfying experience for them. They're only choosing to play the queue because if not they miss out on something, even though they'd rather play a different mode.

Bribing more players into TT is great for the players that really enjoy and want to play the queue (myself included), more players = more up-time. But for the majority, they question "why I can't just get these bonuses playing a mode that I prefer".

You may consider the TT exclusive Graves chroma a similar thing, but the aim of that reward is to recognize the players who care about and play TT regularly enough to earn a Gold ranking.  Non-TT regulars coming into the queue to also earn the reward is just due to the bribe effect to  them, and they aren't the focus of the reward.

I see what your saying there. However you can not realistically say that it may not have the opposite effect. It is actually possible to like both queues. Some people that are playing for the TT chroma might decide that they do actually like the queue and would like to play it more. But can't because of how limited its hours are. 

Anyway thank you for responding to my post and looking in to leaving the queue extended for a bit longer to see if interest sticks. I mean if we find that its a day or 2 too much can't we simply be cut the queue times back a day? It's all about balance right? Also the community can't say you didn't at least give it a go if that turns out to be the case.

Oh and as far as the bribes go can't I get all the rewards for just playing TT? ;)

It's true that the queue being on more hours may attract more players to it. But there have to be enough players coming over to TT to sustain the queue for another day if that's how much it is extended by. So for example, we could see that expanding to Saturday nights brings a 20% increase in TT players (a substantial increase), when sustaining the queue for a third day at the same level of quality would actually require a 50% increase in players.

Players who already play TT on Thurs/Fri may also then choose to play on Saturday. But whenever we've expanded queues times by days (with the exception of the new SR Draft mode) we see most players playing only slightly more or the same amount of the expanded queue, spread out over another day of up-time - which of course, increases queue times and lowers matchmaking quality.

But I am hopeful that the recent drive for players to jump into TT will lead to a good shot at TT surviving a couple of extra nights of expansion.

Overall that sounds very positive.
Thanks so much for giving it a chance. I've been a big advocate ever since OCE server was launched.
So it is good to see it evolve. (Particularly being my favorite game mode)

So I guess it would make sense that if we kept some expansion days that it would be Sat/sun nights.
Yep, Sat/Sun nights for Ranked TT is the expansion slot we're testing.

I love the fact that TT is now available all day (For now) as it's my favorite map, and I tend to play with 2 others most times so TT is perfect. 

A gripe I have with how 2017 worked was the two day options between blind and ranked.  It should be a option for both on the 4 days. Had so many players this season join and have no idea how TT worked compared to SR then just gave up and either fed or went AFK. That's fine for blind pick, TT isn't everyone's cup of tea. But on Thursday and Friday the most tilting thing you can see is "Is this ranked?", "This mode is stupid" or "I have no idea how TT/3s work". Riot always say we want lower queue times, but I am more than happy to wait longer for people who actually know what they are queuing for and want to play ranked.

Sorry, we forgot to update our regular queue schedule post alongside this latest update.
To be clear it is open every day from 3PM to 1AM AEDT.

We have seen a large increase in interest in TT off the back of the season reward announcement. This interest is likely to dissipate as soon as the season ends, but we'll see.
